name: Route equipment requests to Procurement with manager approval via Gmail
description:
This workflow streamlines how employees request **equipment/items** and how those requests reach the **Procurement** team. It validates the employee by enrollment number, detects whether a **manager** exists, and then either requests approval (if the requester has a manager) or routes the request **directly to Procurement** (if the requester is a manager). All messages are written in a professional tone using an LLM, and emails are sent via Gmail with a built-in **approve/deny** step for managers.

## Who’s it for

HR/IT/Operations teams that handle equipment requests, need a lightweight approval flow, and want clean, professional emails without manual drafting.

## How it works

1. Employee submits their **enrollment number**.
2. Workflow fetches employee (and manager, if any).
3. Employee describes the requested item(s).
4. If a manager exists → an **approval email** (double opt-in) is sent to the manager.

   * Approved → notify employee and forward a polished request to **Procurement**.
   * Denied → notify employee.
5. If the requester is a **manager** → skip approval and send directly to **Procurement**.
6. End pages confirm the outcome.

## Requirements

* MySQL (or compatible DB) with an `employees` table (`id, name, email, enrollment_number, manager`).
* Gmail credentials (OAuth) in n8n.
* LLM provider (OpenAI or compatible) for message polishing.

## How to customize

* Replace the Procurement **NoOp** nodes with your email, helpdesk, or ERP integration.
* Adjust email copy and tone in the LLM prompt nodes.
* Add tracking IDs, SLA text, or CCs for auditing.
* Style the forms with your brand (CSS blocks provided).

workflow.name: Route equipment requests to Procurement with manager approval via Gmail

parameters.formDescription: Please fill in your employee ID so we can validate your information and identify your manager

parameters.completionMessage: It was not possible to find your registration based on your enrollment number.

parameters.completionTitle: Request sent for your manager’s approval
parameters.completionMessage: Soon you will receive a response on whether your request has been approved.

parameters.message:
=Dear {{ $('Data and message').item.json.employee.name }},

Your request for the following item(s) has been approved and forwarded to the Procurement Department:

{{ $('Data and message').item.json.output.sanitized_request }}

The purchasing team will proceed with the necessary steps and contact you if additional details are required.

Best regards,  
Equipment request AI

nodes.name: Send request approved to the purchasing department
Send request to the purchasing department

parameters.completionTitle: Request sent to the purchasing department
parameters.completionMessage: Your request has already been forwarded to the purchasing department.

parameters.content:
## Equipment Request — Approval & Procurement Flow

This template lets employees request equipment/items. If the employee has a manager, the request is sent for approval; if approved, it goes to Procurement. If the employee is a manager (no manager record), it goes straight to Procurement.

Flow:
1) Employee enters enrollment number (ID).
2) System fetches employee (and manager, if any).
3) Employee describes the request.
4) If approval is required → email approval to manager (double opt-in).
5) If approved → notify employee and send a polished request to Procurement.
6) If employee is a manager → skip approval and go straight to Procurement.
7) End pages inform the submitter.

Security:
- No hardcoded credentials. Use n8n credentials.
- Avoid exposing employee PII in logs.
- Sanitize free text before sending emails.

Success criteria:
- Employee matched correctly.
- Approval branch triggers when manager exists.
- Clear emails generated (sanitized) for manager and Procurement.
- Notifications sent and final pages rendered without errors.

Collects the employee enrollment number.

Tip:
- Make the label/instructions clear (e.g., where to find the number).
- Consider adding help text and validation regex if your IDs are structured.

Looks up the employee by enrollment_number in `employees`.

Expected columns:
- id, name, email, enrollment_number, manager (nullable)

Always outputs data to allow the IF node to decide next steps.

Checks if the DB lookup returned empty.

TRUE → Show "Employee not found".
FALSE → Continue with the process.

User-facing message when we cannot match the enrollment number.

Customize copy:
- Provide support channel or HR email for corrections.

Normalizes the employee object for later nodes:
- employee.enrollment_number, employee.name, employee.email, employee.manager
- employee.requires_approval = !!manager

Keeps data tidy for merging and prompting the LLM.

Branching:
- TRUE (has manager) → fetch manager and request approval path.
- FALSE (no manager) → direct to Procurement path.

Fetches the manager’s record from `employees` by `id = employee.manager`.

Expected columns:
- id, name, email
Wraps the manager row into a single `manager` object for easy access.

Merges employee and manager streams after DB lookup.
Ensures downstream nodes have both objects available.

Asks the employee what they want to request (free text).

Styling:
- Same CSS system used across forms for consistent UX.

Combines the employee context and the free-text request into one payload.
Downstream nodes can read both without juggling inputs.

Simple gate:
- TRUE → Build an approval email to manager.
- FALSE → Build a Procurement email (employee is a manager).

Prompts the LLM to:
1) Sanitize the request text.
2) Produce a clear approval email for the manager.
3) Return strict JSON: { sanitized_request, email_text }.

Keep tone formal and concise; no invented details.
Combines the sanitized output with employee/manager context for email nodes.

Final screen for the requester after submission in “approval required” path.

Messaging:
- Confirms the request was sent to the manager for approval.
- Sets expectations for response time.

Emails the manager with `email_text` and waits for approval/denial (double approval).

Outputs:
- data.approved = true/false

Ensure your Gmail credential has send permission to manager addresses.

Routes based on manager’s decision:
- TRUE → Notify employee (approved) + build Procurement email (approved version).
- FALSE → Notify employee (denied).

Sends a confirmation to the employee that the request was approved
and forwarded to Procurement.

Customize copy for your internal SLA.

Informs the employee that the manager denied the request.
Consider including a short re-submission instruction.

Generates the Procurement email for an APPROVED request.
Explicitly states the manager’s approval in the text.

Returns JSON: { sanitized_request, email_text }.

Replace this with your actual Procurement notifier:
- Gmail node (to procurement@…),
- Helpdesk ticket (Jira/Zendesk),
- Slack/Teams message,
- ERP API call.

Use `email_text` from the approved message node.

For employees who are managers (no approval required):
- Sanitizes the request,
- Generates Procurement email (no approval mention).

Returns JSON: { sanitized_request, email_text }.

Replace this with your actual Procurement notifier:
- Gmail node (to procurement@…),
- Helpdesk ticket (Jira/Zendesk),
- Slack/Teams message,
- ERP API call.

Use `email_text` from the approved message node.

Final screen when the requester is a manager:
- Confirms it was directly forwarded to Procurement.

main.node: Send request to the purchasing department
Send request approved to the purchasing department

user.name: Gabriel Santos
user.bio:
Enthusiastic developer passionate about automation and system integration.
I work mainly with Python, RPA, and N8N, building workflows and custom solutions to optimize processes and connect platforms. Always learning, sharing, and exploring new ways to automate smarter.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
